commentary_data: Squad: Shikhar Dhawan(c), Prabhsimran Singh, Bhanuka Rajapaksa, Jitesh Sharma(w), Shahrukh Khan, Sam Curran, Sikandar Raza, Nathan Ellis, Harpreet Brar, Rahul Chahar, Arshdeep Singh, Rishi Dhawan, Atharva Taide, Harpreet Singh Bhatia, Matthew Short, Mohit Rathee, Kagiso Rabada, Vidhwath Kaverappa, Baltej Singh, Gurnoor Brar, Raj Bawa, Shivam Singh

Squad: Mayank Agarwal, Anmolpreet Singh(w), Rahul Tripathi, Aiden Markram(c), Harry Brook, Washington Sundar, Abdul Samad, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, T Natarajan, Umran Malik, Adil Rashid, Heinrich Klaasen, Fazalhaq Farooqi, Mayank Markande, Mayank Dagar, Marco Jansen, Abhishek Sharma, Upendra Yadav, Glenn Phillips, Akeal Hosein, Vivrant Sharma, Nitish Reddy, Sanvir Singh, Kartik Tyagi, Samarth Vyas

It's Super Sunday and it's an IPL double-header day! Hello and a warm welcome to today's second encounter. Hyderabad is all set to host its second match of the season. Two teams that have had contrasting starts to their campaigns will lock horns against each other. Hosts Sunrisers Hyderabad are one of the three teams yet to open their account, courtesy two big losses. Punjab Kings, on the other hand, are one of the two teams yet to lose a game. What's in store today? Let's find out..

Nothing has clicked for  so far. They've already used two different opening pairs in as many outings, Harry Brook flopped in both the matches, Mayank Agarwal hasn't been able to bring his domestic form into this tournament and too much has been asked of the lower order. Even their bowling has been well below par. Hyderabad have the worst NRR and are currently languishing at the bottom of the table but it's still early days in the tourney. It'll be interesting to see what changes they make. The probably missed a trick by not using Heinrich Klaasen as the Impact Player in the previous match. Should Marco Jansen make it to the XI? How long will they back Brook? A lot to ponder for the Sunrisers!

Lost the toss twice, asked to bat first twice but  emerged victorious on both occasions. Three Indian batters in the top-four - Prabhsimran Singh, Shikhar Dhawan and Jitesh Sharma - made notable contributions in both the games. Bhanuka Rajapaksa scored a fifty in the first match but was forced to retire hurt in the previous match as he suffered a blow on the hand when he was standing at the non-striker's end. Following Punjab's win over RR, the Sri Lankan tweeted "The X-rays have cleared me of any broken bones/fractures! Plenty of ice needed but I'm doing fine!" In the bowling department, Arshdeep Singh has been brilliant with the new ball and Nathan Ellis continues to show his worth in this format, especially at the death overs. And they also have Sam Curran who loves to perform in pressure situations. The Kings won't be tinkering their winning combination too much.

When you play at different venues, it (new ball) behaves differently. We are a very good side, it's a balanced side. Nothing went right in the first two matches. We can turn things around. From hereon, we can improve. The support we get here has been amazing. If you look at our record at this venue, it's amazing, it gives us a boost. I don't look at the surface, I bowl the first ball and assess.
receives his Punjab Kings cap from Trevor Bayliss! He might be coming in for Rajapaksa.

We've moved from red soil to black soil. It's certainly dry. We can see a few cracks. The team winning the toss will potentially bat first. Expect a little bit of swing with the new ball. Should spin a little bit more than we saw the other day. It's devoid of grass as well. All in all, a pretty good surface. Bat first, put runs on the board.
A couple of caps being handed out in the SRH camp as well - Heinrich Klaasen and Mayank Markande

We'll bowl first. We are happy to chase. Looks like a good surface. Hopefully we can bowl well upfront. To the eye, it looks a lot better. The atmosphere has been pretty calm, you can't fix anything in a day technically. Hopefully we can get our first win. Two new caps are Klaasen and Mayank Markande, excited for them.

We wanted to bat first. There was no dew yesterday. We'd like to put a big total. They've lost two games while chasing, so we'll like to put them under pressure again. It looks like a very good wicket and I'm sure it's going to have true bounce. We are keeping a good  environment in the side and the whole team is  performing, that's very important. We have an experienced bowling side. In the batting, we have experience and youngsters. Short comes in for Bhanuka.
(Playing XI): Shikhar Dhawan(c), Prabhsimran Singh, Matthew Short, Jitesh Sharma(w), Shahrukh Khan, Sam Curran, Nathan Ellis, Mohit Rathee, Harpreet Brar, Rahul Chahar, Arshdeep Singh
(Playing XI): Mayank Agarwal, Harry Brook, Rahul Tripathi, Aiden Markram(c), Heinrich Klaasen(w), Washington Sundar, Marco Jansen, Bhuvneshwar Kumar, Mayank Markande, Umran Malik, T Natarajan

Rinku Singh went I0$ in Ahmedabad and that means Punjab are the only unbeaten side this season. A win tonight will take them to the top of the table. Right then, it's action time here in Hyderabad. Both teams got what they wanted at the toss and the players have taken their respective positions. Bhuvi has the new ball in his hand. Two slips in position. Off we go...
Bhuvneshwar to Prabhsimran,  Lbw!!

Bhuvneshwar to Prabhsimran,  Lbw!! On the money straightaway! 127.6kph, seam-up ball that jags back in a bit off the deck from a short of a good length. Prabhsimran is rooted in his crease and doesn't account for the inward movement as he looks to defend. Beaten on the inside edge and struck on the back leg adjacent to the sticks. The umpire's finger went up quickly and Prabhsimran didn't review it. Ball-tracking shows it to be clipping top of middle (umpire's call). Perfect start for Bhuvneshwar and SRH!
Bhuvneshwar to Short, , inswinger, full and down leg, past Short's flick
Bhuvneshwar to Short, 1 run, length ball that holds its line outside off, Short pushes with hard hands and gets an outside edge that dribbles down to third man
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , Bhuvneshwar sees the batter shimmy down and bowls a full delivery wide of off. The ball further moves away and that's been wided
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run, 127.5kph, fuller in length, angled across the left-hander and Dhawan shoulders arms. Good carry-through to the keeper
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, 2 runs, 126.8kph, leg-lined ball, flicked away with the swing to backward square leg
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , 131.1kph, fullish delivery swinging away, Dhawan skips down the track and push-drives in the direction of the swing. Beats the diving backward point fielder to his left

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run, 130.3kph, slanted across the left-hander from a fullish length, Dhawan jogs down the track and lets it pass. Was just inside the tramline. End of an eventful opening over
Marco Jansen to Short, , full delivery that curls in a bit but Jansen errs with his line. Just down leg and Short misses the flick
A slip in place
A slip in place

Marco Jansen to Short, no run, 138.2kph, lbw appeal, struck down. Short stands tall and looks to heave across the line. The short of a good length ball shapes in a bit to hit him high on the back thigh
Marco Jansen to Short,  Lbw!!

Marco Jansen to Short,  Lbw!! LBW appeal, umpire Bruce Oxenford raises his finger! Short has a word with his batting partner - Dhawan - and decides not to review. Only an inside edge could have saved him here. , full and swinging in, Short stays in his crease and tries to play an expansive drive. He didn't expect the ball to come in so much. Beaten comprehensively on the inside edge and he's pinned on the back leg adjacent to the sticks. That's plumb!

Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, no run, now, Jitesh Sharma has been adjudged lbw. Another inswinger, beats the batter's inside edge to rap him on the front pad as he looks to work it into the on-side. He was walking forward as well. No bat. Over to ball-tracking and it's swinging down leg. Successful review!

Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, , no swing, fullish and angled across, Jitesh Sharma throws his bat for a drive sans any feet movement. Gets a thick outside edge and the ball eludes first slip to his right before running away to third man for four
Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, no run, full and swinging in, pushed down the pitch
Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, no run, another inswinger, Jitesh Sharma offers a vertical bat to knock it back to Jansen
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run,  Superb delivery. Lands on a good length around off and nibbles away outside off to beat the defensive outside edge of Dhawan. The line forced the batter to poke at it
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run, 130.3kph, short of length delivery, Dhawan jogs down the track and pats it to cover point
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run, 126.7kph, shimmies down the track again, moves leg-side on this occasion and cuts straight to backward point
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , 131.1kph, Bhuvneshwar goes fuller and wider, no movement and Dhawan pushes it straight of mid-off. Yes, just a push but the timing was spot-on
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run, 133.6kph, Bhuvneshwar pulls his length back by a fraction and squares up the batter as he gets it to nip away a bit. Dhawan awkwardly keeps it out on the off-side
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , aerial and four! Dhawan comes down the track, negates any movement and opens his bat-face to drive it up and over the covers
Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, no run, 135.2kph, short of length ball with extra bounce, hits Jitesh Sharma high on the bat before going towards mid-off
Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, no run, pitched up delivery, driven off the front foot but straight to cover
Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, no run, pitched up delivery, driven off the front foot but straight to cover
Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, no run, 134kph, well-directed short ball, just above the shoulder and Jitesh Sharma sways away from it
Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma, no run, pitched up delivery, driven straight to mid-off
Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma,  Caught!!

Marco Jansen to Jitesh Sharma,  Caught by Markram!! Straight to mid-off! , length ball, Jitesh Sharma neither gets the required elevation nor does he get the placement right. Plays an uppish drive and it's catching practice for Markram at mid-off. After four dots, Jitesh was forced to take a risk and he perishes.
Two slips in place...
PBKS missing the services of Bhanuka Rajapaksa badly.
Marco Jansen to Sam Curran, no run, 139.5kph, full and angled in on middle and leg, pushed to mid-off.
T Natarajan to Dhawan, 1 run, 126.7kph, length ball angled in, Dhawan jogs down and drives towards mid-off for a quick single
T Natarajan to Sam Curran, no run, 132.2kph, in-slanting length ball, tapped to cover

T Natarajan to Sam Curran, 1 run, 130.9kph, punched to the right of mid-off for a sharp single. The fielder has a shy at the sticks at the non-striker's end. A direct-hit would have made things interesting

T Natarajan to Dhawan, , 130.4kph, fullish delivery with a bit of away swing, Dhawan slices the drive and the ball falls short of the backward point fielder. Washington Sundar got a hand on it but the ball still had the legs to reach the fence. The ball actually spun away and hence the fielder couldn't stop it
T Natarajan to Dhawan, 2 runs, skips down the track and whips away to deep mid-wicket
T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, 133.9kph, Dhawan jogs down the track to block this in-angler back to Natarajan
Marco Jansen to Sam Curran, , wow! 135.2kph, short of length delivery marginally outside off, Sam Curran stands tall and slams it over long-on for a 92m six. Stand and deliver
Marco Jansen to Sam Curran, , four more! Shaping away outside off on a good length, Sam Curran throws his arms at it to flay it up and over the covers. Too wide and Curran pounced!
Marco Jansen to Sam Curran, no run, , fuller and angled in, pushed to mid-off

Marco Jansen to Sam Curran, 1 run, 135.9kph, back of a length delivery, a hopping Curran taps it in front of backward point. Dhawan calls for the single and a direct hit at the keeper's end would have been curtains for the skipper
Marco Jansen to Dhawan, no run, 125.8kph, slower delivery on a good length, Dhawan blocks it back to the bowler
Marco Jansen to Dhawan, no run, 125.8kph, slower delivery on a good length, Dhawan blocks it back to the bowler
Some disturbance behind the bowler as Jansen runs in and Dhawan moves away...
Marco Jansen to Dhawan, no run, 137.6kph, in-slanter, tapped to cover point and Dhawan eyes a single. Gets rightly sent back

Washington Sundar to Sam Curran, , 92.5kph, Sam Curran greets Washington Sundar with a boundary. Shortish ball spinning away outside off, Curran rocks back quickly and slaps the cut through extra cover
Washington Sundar to Sam Curran, 1 run, 96.4kph, darted in on a length, knocked to long-on
Washington Sundar to Dhawan, no run, 94.9kph, no room on offer, fired in from a length, punched back to the bowler
Washington Sundar to Dhawan, no run, , quicker ball, Dhawan shapes up to pull and only manages to get an inside edge onto his boot
Washington Sundar to Dhawan, 1 run, 98.3kph, full on middle and leg, worked through mid-wicket
Washington Sundar to Sam Curran, no run, 93.2kph, length ball around off, pushed to the right of the bowler
T Natarajan to Dhawan, , Natarajan goes full and in the slot on the stumps, Dhawan gets forward and lofts straight down the ground, takes four
T Natarajan to Dhawan, 1 run, back of a length outside off, Dhawan punches to sweeper cover
T Natarajan to Sam Curran, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter outside off, Sam Curran goes for a big drive and the thick inside-edge flies away through the vacant mid-wicket area
T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, back of a length outside off, Dhawan punches to backward point
T Natarajan to Dhawan, , fabulous late-cut. A back of a length delivery just outside off, Dhawan delays the cut and sends it to the left of backward point, races away
T Natarajan to Dhawan, 1 run, slower ball off-cutter on off, Dhawan gets forward to drive to long-on
Markande to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up legbreak outside off, Dhawan gets forward to drive to long-off
Markande to Dhawan, 1 run, tossed up legbreak outside off, Dhawan gets forward to drive to long-off
Markande to Sam Curran, no run, flat good length delivery outside off, Sam Curran mistimes the cut to cover
Markande to Sam Curran, , Sam Curran is looking to be positive, this skids on outside off, fraction short and Curran cuts between two fielders at backward point
Markande to Sam Curran, no run, nicely tossed up googly outside off, left alone
Markande to Sam Curran,  Caught!!

Markande to Sam Curran,  Caught by Bhuvneshwar!! Superbly bowled, deceived Sam Curran who was charging down, bowled it slower and wider outside off, the googly as well, Curran swipes across the line and the thick outside-edge loops to short third man.
PBKS looked be recovering through this stand between Sam Curran and Dhawan but the former's wicket has again placed them in trouble. Dhawan though is looking good and will have to stay till the end.
Markande to Raza, 1 run, risky shot that but Raza gets bat on the sweep, had he missed that, was right in front of off-stump too, is off the mark with a single to deep backward square leg
Umran Malik to Raza, , slides down leg, the length delivery and Raza misses the flick
Umran Malik to Raza, no run, back of a length on off, Raza punches to cover. Just the 139.8kph on that ball
Umran Malik to Raza, 2 runs, short of length just outside off, Raza punches wide of sweeper cover and comes back for a couple
Umran Malik to Raza, no run, back of a length and angling into off-stump, cramps Raza up who is looking to pull, inside-edges it and rolls back
Umran Malik to Raza, 2 runs, mid-on was inside and Raza gets lucky. 147.7kph, short of length outside off, Raza pulls and just clears Bhuvi at mid-on
Umran Malik to Raza,  Caught!!

Umran Malik to Raza,  Caught by Mayank!! Disappointing end for Raza once again. Did he not know that third man was fine? Good short ball, angling into Raza and always following him, Raza arches back and ramps it, but does not get the elevation to clear Mayank. The Impact sub too goes cheaply and SRH well on top.
Umran Malik to Shahrukh Khan, , wow! 150.4kph short of length delivery heading to off and SRK has punched this after standing tall wide of mid-off. Talk about meeting fire with fire
Umran Malik to Shahrukh Khan, , wow! 150.4kph short of length delivery heading to off and SRK has punched this after standing tall wide of mid-off. Talk about meeting fire with fire
This looks like a more settled combo from SRH, irrespective of the impact sub. If they can win today, watch out other teams!!
Markande to Dhawan, no run, nice googly  outside off, tossed up and Dhawan nearly falls over as he misses the drive, Klaasen has the bails off but Dhawan's back foot is in
Markande to Dhawan, 1 run, flat good length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
Markande to Shahrukh Khan, no run, Markande is bowling really well, rips the legbreak past the push of SRK, flat trajectory, Klaasen has the bails off but SRK is in. No bat as UltraEdge confirms
Markande to Shahrukh Khan,  Lbw!!

Markande to Shahrukh Khan,  Lbw!! SRK is plumb LBW here but takes the review. He has a word with Dhawan and the skipper signals. What a lovely googly and SRK has no clue, the bat is miles from the ball as it comes down for the forward defence, the ball raps the pads and you don't get plumber LBWs than that. Hang on - it is just ump's call on clipping leg-stump, but that will do. The review is not lost as well. The googly spun and to the naked eye it looked to be crashing into the stumps.
Markande to Harpreet Brar, 1 run, tossed up full outside off, Harpreet Brar gets forward to drive to long-off
Markande to Dhawan, 1 run, too full outside off, Dhawan gets forward to drive to long-off
Umran Malik to Dhawan, 1 run, Umran Malik round the wicket, 144kph back of a length delivery outside off, cut to sweeper cover
Umran Malik to Harpreet Brar,  Bowled!!

Umran Malik to Harpreet Brar,  Bowled!! Knocked him over. 148kph length delivery angling into off and middle, zips off the deck, right through the forward defence of Harpreet Brar who left a tiny gap for the ball to burst through. Umran Malik punches the air in his trademark celebration.

Umran Malik to Rahul Chahar, no run,  Umran does not know it, umpire Bruce Oxenford mentions that to him. 148.5kph, rocket but full down leg, Rahul Chahar shuffles across and flicks, so , UltraEdge picks up the spike. No wonder Umran was so excited

How crucial was Bhanuka to the team. Had he been there and counterattacked SRH, they would've had a chance to post a good total and would've bought in Rabada as impact, who is lethal with Ellis. All that is a theory now.
A wide slip in
Umran Malik to Rahul Chahar, no run, short of length on off, Rahul Chahar gets right behind the line to defend
Umran Malik to Rahul Chahar, no run, fuller than a good length and attacking off-stump, Rahul Chahar shuffles across and defends to short mid-wicket

But hang on here - the third ump is checking for a caught behind as per the protocols. Thankfully for Chahar a flat line on UltraEdge. So we move on. Will this be a wide? The third ump feels Chahar has moved from his original position to the off-side, so no wide

Umran Malik to Rahul Chahar, no run, down leg, short of length and Rahul Chahar shuffles across slightly to pull, misses, close to the bat and glove, ump shakes his head as Chahar looks for the wide. Dhawan reviews. They check for a caught behind first and then the third ump feels that Chahar has moved, so no wide.

Umran Malik to Rahul Chahar, no run, down leg, short of length and Rahul Chahar shuffles across slightly to pull, misses, close to the bat and glove, ump shakes his head as Chahar looks for the wide. Dhawan reviews. They check for a caught behind first and then the third ump feels that Chahar has moved, so no wide.
Markande to Dhawan, 1 run, flat good length outside off, tapped to the cover-point region
Markande to Rahul Chahar, no run, tossed up on off, Rahul Chahar gets forward to block
Markande to Rahul Chahar, no run, good length and hint of width outside off, Rahul Chahar dabs late but Markram at slip dives to his right to save runs
Markande to Rahul Chahar, no run, pushed through from the front of the hand, no spin, length ball outside off, punched to cover
This looks plumb too. Unless Rahul Chahar has got outside off which I'm certain he has not. Gone
Markande to Rahul Chahar,  Lbw!!

Markande to Rahul Chahar,  Lbw!! Another ump's call - this time on impact and Rahul Chahar has to go. Fair call from umpire Ulhas Gandhe to give that out. The tossed up googly outside off, Chahar goes for a big slogsweep without picking it, misses, is hit on the back leg, the ump thinks it's out and the review shows ball-tracking to be ump's call on impact on off-stump and crashing into the stumps. PBKS sinking badly.
Markande to Nathan Ellis, no run, too full outside off, Nathan Ellis pushes to mid-off but Dhawan is in no mood to go to the other end
Umran Malik to Dhawan, , 147.3kph, short of length delivery outside off and it went off the bat even faster. Dhawan slashes the cut and sends it to the third man fence

It was written before the start of the innings that Punjab are the only unbeaten side till now. Seems like it's gonna change in an hour unless Arsh and Ellis pull off a miracle which is next to impossible. But we witnessed Rinku just few hours earlier ... anything can happen
Umran Malik to Dhawan, no run, 145.2kph, short of length delivery tucking up Dhawan on the body, he misses the pull, is hit on the thigh
Umran Malik to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length angling into the thighs, Dhawan whips it to fine-leg and takes the single
Umran Malik to Nathan Ellis, no run, 144.2kph and Umran Malik goes full on leg-stump, Nathan Ellis is not bothered to come in line, stays leg-side of the ball and flicks to mid-wicket
Umran Malik to Nathan Ellis, no run, 144.9kph, back of a length just outside off, Nathan Ellis mistimes the pull, rolls away towards mid-on
Umran Malik to Nathan Ellis, no run, 144.3kph, full on off, Nathan Ellis plays a nice drive with an open face to sweeper cover but Dhawan does not want the run
Markande to Dhawan, no run, tossed up googly on middle, Dhawan gets forward to drive and it skews off a thick outside-edge to backward point
Markande to Dhawan, no run, slower and the legbreak spins back in, Dhawan is early into the pull, misses, is hit on the body, impact may have been just outside off
Markande to Dhawan, no run, slower legbreak on the stumps, Dhawan plays a perfect forward defence
Markande to Dhawan, , tossed up and Dhawan shimmies down the track to loft, was the googly but he got to the pitch and slammed it straight down the ground
Markande to Dhawan, , tossed up and Dhawan shimmies down the track to loft, was the googly but he got to the pitch and slammed it straight down the ground
Markande to Dhawan, 1 run, full on leg-stump, Dhawan sweeps to deep square leg
Markande to Nathan Ellis,  Bowled!!

Markande to Nathan Ellis,  Bowled!! What a daft shot. Dhawan must be livid. What was Nathan Ellis trying to do there. Last ball of Markande's spell and Ellis tries a fancy reverse-sweep to a googly, misses and the ball turns in to hit off and middle. Markande finishes with a four-fer.
Mayank Markande worked hard for a comeback into IPL.Deserved wicket every one of those!!
T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, yorker length outside off, Dhawan drives to long-off. Does not take the single and understandably

T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, good stop by backward point who gets across and cuts it off with a dive to his right, Dhawan shuffles across way outside off and then Natarajan follows him there, dabbed away in the end
T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, low full-toss on the stumps, Dhawan mistimes the drive to long-off
T Natarajan to Dhawan, ,  But he has been the lone man standing. A slower ball off-cutter outside off, slugged meatily into the crowd at deep mid-wicket
T Natarajan to Dhawan, , six more. Dhawan waits and waits before shuffling across, this is a low full-toss outside off, scooped over fine-leg, clears the short boundary on the full
Natarajan runs in and then stops. Has to come again
T Natarajan to Dhawan, 1 run, perfect result for PBKS and Dhawan. Full outside off, he comes down the track and drives to long-off
It has been just Dhawan and nothing else. With four overs left, and just a wicket left, it's all on Dhawan or nothing for PBKS.
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run, beautiful yorker on middle, Dhawan was going low to either sweep or scoop but can only tap it back. Wry smiles from both Dhawan and Bhuvneshwar
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , full down leg, Dhawan flicks it away effortlessly wide of fine-leg, placed it to the deep backward square leg fence
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , full down leg, Dhawan flicks it away effortlessly wide of fine-leg, placed it to the deep backward square leg fence
Dhawan now holds the Orange Cap too
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run,  A low full-toss on the stumps, Dhawan punches it back, Bhuvneshwar can't hang on as it slips out
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, 1 run, Dhawan hints that he is going for the scoop, it's short of length on the stumps, so he taps it to the vacant mid-wicket area. Takes the single
Two balls left for Mohit Rathee to survive. A wide slip in too
Bhuvneshwar to Mohit Rathee, 1 run, short of length outside off, Mohit Rathee opens the face of the bat and runs it down to third man
Bhuvneshwar has a chat with Markram about field placings.
Is this too high? It's over the head of Dhawan so a wide
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , dug in short on the stumps, Dhawan lets it go as it is over the head, wide called. SRH review and lose it

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, leg byes, 1 run, Markram asks umpire Ulhas Gandhe if they have a review left?  A short of length delivery on the stumps, did it pitch in line? Dhawan tucks across the line and misses, rapped on the thigh and Bhuvneshwar wants an LBW decision. Does not get it. Looked to be high
Umran Malik to Dhawan, no run, back of a length outside off, Dhawan slashes it to sweeper cover on the bounce

Umran Malik to Dhawan, , six more. It's short of length outside off, Dhawan pulls and the top-edge carries to Bhuvi at fine-leg who does not judge it well, , his momentum was taking him over, the ball falls out of the hands and outside the cushions. Bhuvi never looked like taking that
Umran Malik to Dhawan, , superb shot. Full outside off, in the slot, Dhawan just short-arm jabs the loft and easily clears mid-off, one bounce over the ropes
Umran Malik to Dhawan, no run, back of a length outside off, 146kph, Dhawan pulls and misses
Umran Malik to Dhawan, , 144.5kph, short on off, Dhawan is rushed but pulls and another top-edge carries over the fence, this time over deep backward square leg
I0$ I'm not sure how that works!
Umran Malik to Dhawan, 1 run, short of length into the body, Dhawan tucks to the vacant mid-wicket area for a single and retains the strike with that run
This is now the highest 10th wicket partnership in IPL history, bettering 31* between Tom Curran & Ankit Rajpoot for RR against KKR in Dubai in 2020.
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run, Bhuvneshwar does well, follows Dhawan outside the leg-stump as he backs away, cramps him, the short of length delivery is punched to cover
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run, Bhuvneshwar does well, follows Dhawan outside the leg-stump as he backs away, cramps him, the short of length delivery is punched to cover

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, no run,  Yes it is. A low full-toss on the stumps, driven back and this went near shin-height to Bhuvneshwar who drops it off his own bowling after getting both hands. The last one he dropped off his own bowling was easier as it was waist-height, this was tougher

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , Dhawan keeps rocking. A back of a length delivery outside off, Dhawan opens the face of the bat and drives through point, in the air but in the gap and beats sweeper cover to his right

Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, , incredible wrists from Dhawan. So strong he is fitness-wise. Full and wide outside off, initially Dhawan was setting up for the scoop, then I0$ and reverse-scoops between backward point and short third man. Sensational
The camera pans to SRH's Kavya Maran who sees herself on the big screen and is not too happy.
Bhuvneshwar to Dhawan, 1 run, back of a length dug in, across Dhawan who pulls to deep backward square leg and takes the run
Dhawan has a word with Mohit Rathee
Bhuvneshwar to Mohit Rathee, no run, fullish on the pads, flicked away nicely and it goes to deep backward square leg and rightly Dhawan turns down the run
T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, too cute for his own good this time. Was a low full-toss down leg, Dhawan premeditated the reverse-sweep and finds backward point. A dot
T Natarajan to Dhawan, 2 runs, low full-toss on the stumps, Dhawan slams it wide of long-on and on the bounce to Brook, who runs and parries it down. Can't prevent the two
T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, low full-toss on the stumps, Dhawan shuffles across and gets low, sweeps to Bhuvi at fine-leg. Dhawan did not get under that
T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, beautiful yorker length delivery on off, Dhawan can only jam it down to deep point. No chance for two so Dhawan does not run
Can Dhawan get to a 100? Will be one of the all-time great 100s in this format, if he can get there.
T Natarajan to Dhawan, no run, he can't unless there is extras from Natarajan. A low full-toss outside off, Dhawan reverse-sweeps and finds backward point
This is called real One Man Show
T Natarajan to Dhawan, ,  A pity that Dhawan finishes on 99. Slams the low full-toss on the stumps over deep mid-wicket after going low to get under the ball. Walks off still smiling. I0$

Bizarre innings fron PBKS.  Bizarre things happened in the innings too - I0$. Anyway PBKS will have to thank Dhawan for one of the best T20 innings of all-time considering how shambolically bad the others were. It all started with Prabhsimran getting out first ball of the innings to Bhuvi and the caravan just did not stop. Dhawan saw one after the other leave as SRH's seamers and Mayank Markande's leggies and googlies proved to be lethal.  From 63/3 PBKS slipped to 78/8 and then 88/9 at the end of 15 overs. But Dhawan then took charge as 55 came off the last 5 overs in which he farmed the strike. Only good bowling from Natarajan in the last over denied what was a fantastic and thoroughly well-deserved 100 for Dhawan. Some of the shots that PBKS played in that collapse was shocking to say the least. Dhawan's innings has given PBKS a tiny lease of life though. Can they make use of it? Back for the chase shortly...

I am glad that the Hyderabad crowd still remembers me. I have played a few ones, this was one of the best maybe. It is good because I played till the end and the wickets were falling from the other end. So, we have got to a respectable total and given ourselves a chance.

Welcome back for the chase. Three different opening pairs in three matches for SRH. Brook is Mayank Agarwal's opening partner tonight. Let's find out how they fare. Sam Curran has the new ball in his hand. A slip in place. Off we go....

Sam Curran to Harry Brook, , Brook gets off the mark with a boundary straightaway! 130kph, fullish delivery wide of off, Harry Brook leans across and plays a cracking drive through the covers. Came right off the middle of the bat and raced away to the fence
Sam Curran to Harry Brook, no run, 129.1kph, full delivery that swings in towards off, driven to cover
Sam Curran to Harry Brook, no run, 130.2kph, overpitched delivery outside off, driven firmly off the front foot but straight to cover
Sam Curran to Harry Brook, no run, 119.1kph, slower delivery, tapped to backward point with an opened bat-face
Sam Curran to Harry Brook, no run, 117.4kph, another off-pace ball, Brook spots it late and miscues the punch to mid-off

Sam Curran to Harry Brook, no run, hat-trick of slower deliveries from Curran. Harry Brook is early into his drive and gets an outside edge that dribbles to short third man. Five dots after conceding a boundary off the first ball of the over
Arshdeep Singh to Mayank, no run, 138kph, full and angled across the right-hander, just inside the tramline and Mayank shoulders arms
Arshdeep Singh to Mayank, no run, 138kph, full and angled across the right-hander, just inside the tramline and Mayank shoulders arms

Arshdeep Singh to Mayank, , 134.8kph, too full, too wide and Mayank pounces. Gets forward and plays a superb square drive beating the point fielder to his left. Bulleted away to the fence. Agarwal gets off the mark with a boundary!
Arshdeep Singh to Mayank, no run, , dug in short, Mayank gently pulls it to mid-wicket

Arshdeep Singh to Mayank, no run, 133.4kph, Arshdeep switches to round the wicket and bowls an in-slanting short of a good length ball. Mayank tries to dab it away and gets an under edge. Jitesh Sharma moves across to take it on the bounce

Arshdeep Singh to Mayank, , 138.8kph, dug in short, leg-lined with fine leg inside the circle. Mayank picks the length early, gets inside the line and pulls it away for a one-bounce four. Used the bowler's angle and pace to his advantage
Arshdeep Singh to Mayank, 1 run, 133.9kph, Arshdeep goes fuller and that's been driven towards mid-off for a quick single
Spin time...
Harpreet Brar to Mayank, no run, full and drifting in, Agarwal looks to clip it away and the ball ballons up off his pad before falling in no-man's land. He might have got an inside edge too
Harpreet Brar to Mayank, , 85.9kph, trifle short and Mayank pounces. Rocks back, moves leg-side and slaps it through the covers. Struck hard and into the gap
Mayank Agarwal has got a great opportunity to get some runs and get back to form, and I hope he will. (mostly because he's my fantasy VC)
Harpreet Brar to Mayank, 1 run, 91.1kph, quicker and fuller, Mayank eases the drive to long-off
Harpreet Brar to Harry Brook, no run, 86.8kph, skids off the pitch from a good length, Harry Brook plays off the back foot and hurriedly brings his bat down to somehow keep it out on the off-side
Harpreet Brar to Harry Brook, no run, 84.1kph, middle-stump line pushed back to the bowler
Harpreet Brar to Harry Brook, 1 run, slap-driven to long-off off the back foot

Arshdeep Singh to Harry Brook, , 135.2kph, superb placement! Quick hands as well from the Englishman. Moves leg-side, exposes all his stumps and scythes this short of length ball through the gap between short third man and backward point

Arshdeep Singh to Harry Brook, , hammered! 119kph, off-speed and overpitched, Harry Brook drills it straight down the ground. Came off the inner part of the bat but the ball had the legs to reach the fence in a hurry
Arshdeep Singh to Harry Brook, no run, , full and wide of off, Harry Brook reaches out for an expansive drive and inside-edges to mid-wicket
Arshdeep Singh to Harry Brook, no run, , low full toss, Brook drives it straight to point after backing away
Arshdeep Singh to Harry Brook,  Bowled!!

Arshdeep Singh to Harry Brook,  Bowled!! Arshdeep Singh has his arms aloft and stares at the batter. 117.6kph, knuckle ball, Harry Brook doesn't pick it and is way too early into his drive. The ball goes through the bat-pad gap to uproot the leg-stump. Punjab have the breakthrough and once again it's Arshdeep who has provided it for them.

Arshdeep Singh to Harry Brook,  Bowled!! Arshdeep Singh has his arms aloft and stares at the batter. 117.6kph, knuckle ball, Harry Brook doesn't pick it and is way too early into his drive. The ball goes through the bat-pad gap to uproot the leg-stump. Punjab have the breakthrough and once again it's Arshdeep who has provided it for them.
Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run, 137.9kph, stays round the wicket and bowls a fullish delivery outside off, Tripathi covers his off-stump before shouldering arms
Nathan Ellis to Mayank, no run, Ellis starts with a slower delivery, full in length and the ball curled away a bit, defensively pushed into the off-side
Nathan Ellis to Mayank, no run, 134.7kph, length ball angled in on middle, blunted to mid-wicket

Nathan Ellis to Mayank, 1 run, 132.5kph,  Good length delivery, Mayank drives with limited feet movement and gets a thick outside edge. Jitesh Sharma dives to his right and goes for a one-handed catch but fails to hold onto it. He was slow to move
Nathan Ellis to Tripathi, 1 run, 134.6kph, off-stump line, Tripathi plays with soft hands and drops it in front of point before haring to the other end
If Punjab wants to come back into the game, Rahul Chahar needs to come in early and pull off a Markande. Maybe even within the powerplay.
Nathan Ellis to Mayank, 1 run, 108.78kph, slower delivery, full in length, eased through cover point off the front foot
Nathan Ellis to Tripathi, no run, 136.2kph, on a length and just outside off, Tripathi opens his bat-face and steers it straight to short third man
Sam Curran to Mayank, no run, yes-no situation! 120.6kph, off-speed full ball, clipped towards mid-wicket and Tripathi gets sent back. No direct hit and Tripathi put in a dive to make his ground
Sam Curran to Mayank, 1 run, 122.2kph, pace off and shorter in length, Mayank backs away and slaps it towards mid-off for a quick single
Sam Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, 133.7kph, bit of width on offer and Tripathi cuts hard off the back foot. Backward point makes a half-stop diving to his right
Sam Curran to Mayank, 1 run, slower ball into the pitch, pulled to deep mid-wicket
Sam Curran to Tripathi, no run, 132.7kph, pitched up ball, driven straight to mid-off
Sam Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, 120.7kph, dug in short, swivel-pulled through mid-wicket
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, no run, 92kph, quick and flat around off, Tripathi stays in his crease and brings his bat down in time to keep it out on the off-side
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, no run, 92kph, quick and flat around off, Tripathi stays in his crease and brings his bat down in time to keep it out on the off-side
There's a slip in place
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, no run, 91.6kph, lands just outside off and spins sharply with bounce, Tripathi shuffles across to sweep and misses
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, no run, too full, driven hard but straight to cover

Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, , full and drifting in, Tripathi gets down on one leg and goes after it with a slogsweep. Sam Curran, at deep mid-wicket, was a few inches in front of the boundary rope. He leaps but to no avail
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, no run, good comeback from Chahar. Away-turner, Tripathi tries to steer it towards third man and is beaten on the outside edge
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, no run, another play and miss! 88.2kph, flighted leggie outside off, Tripathi connects with thin air as he shapes up to slog-sweep
Spin from both ends now as Brar returns for a bowl.
Harpreet Brar to Mayank, 1 run, full ball, drifting in, turned to mid-wicket. The fielder from the deep rushes in and overruns the ball, but the batters don't take the risk for the second
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, no run, tossed up ball around middle and leg, pushed off the front foot to the left of Harpreet Brar
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, no run, coming in with the arm, pushed off the  back foot back to the bowler

Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, no run,  Missed the off-stump by a whisker! This one is quicker and flatter just outside off, doesn't turn as Tripathi tries to cut it away but misses as the ball flies past the off-stump
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, 1 run, tossed up ball outside off, eased to cover point for a single
Harpreet Brar to Mayank, 1 run, this one pitches on a length and holds on the surface, Mayank mistimes his pull towards deep mid-wicket to retain strike
Rahul Chahar to Mayank, 1 run, floated around middle, driven towards the left of Rahul Chahar who gets a hand to it but the ball parries behind allowing the single
"So far I'm not happy with SRH's approach, This is a good batting surface, they need to score runs at a quicker rate."
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, 1 run, very full ball on middle, jammed down to long-on
Rahul Chahar to Mayank,  Caught!!

Rahul Chahar to Mayank,  Caught by Sam Curran!!  Tossed up ball around off, Mayank kneels down and goes for a slog sweep although he is not quite to the pitch of it. Ends up toe-ending it towards long-on. Curran is cool as a cucumber as he keeps his eyes on the ball, watches it closely and catches it with his hands going behind.

This was coming! We already saw how much assistance Markande extracted from the surface in the first innings. And now, Chahar is getting the ball to talk. Brar is also keeping it tight.  It's not going to be easy.

This was coming! We already saw how much assistance Markande extracted from the surface in the first innings. And now, Chahar is getting the ball to talk. Brar is also keeping it tight.  It's not going to be easy.
Rahul Chahar to Markram, 1 run, on a length on middle and leg, turned to deep mid-wicket for a run

Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, ,  He knew that there was no protecting on the off-side behind and executes his shot to perfection. Turning away from Tripathi as he dabs it past the diving slip fielder and backward point can't cut it off after a chase

Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, , back-to-back boundaries! This one is shorter than the previous ball. A lot of time for Tripathi to rock back and cut it behind point. No chance for the fielder in the deep to cut it off
Harpreet Brar to Markram, 1 run, fraction short outside off, placed off the back foot to covers
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, no run, looy full ball on middle and leg, pushed off the front foot to extra cover

Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, , Tripathi is all of a sudden motoring along! Drifting towards the pads, Tripathi plants his front foot across, kneels, and sweeps it past the right of short fine to find the fence
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, , tossed up ball, Tripathi stays leg side of the ball, comes down the track and lofts it over extra cover for another boundary
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, ,  A bit short around off, Tripathi rocks back and essays a cut shot through covers. Ellis at sweeper cover moves to his right, dives but makes a meal of it
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, no run, full ball. pushed off the front foot back to the bowler.
Rahul Chahar to Markram, 1 run, loopy full ball outside off, knocked down to long-off for a run
"cricbuzz Had Dhawan or Mohit got out, would Arshdeep be coming to bat?" -- No, only 11 players can bat.
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, no run, on a length, coming in with the arm, Tripathi dabs it towards short third as the fielder moves to his left to stop it
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, , Tripathi is on a roll! All the pressure that was created has fazed off. Quicker ball and it's full around off, blasted over extra cover for another boundary

PBKS review against a caught behind call! Tripathi was shaking his head, indicating there was nothing on it. Replay rolls in and yes, he is right. There's clear gap between bat and ball and Tripathi will carry on!

Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, no run, PBKS review against a caught behind call! Tripathi was shaking his head, indicating there was nothing on it. Replay rolls in and yes, he is right. There's clear daylight between bat and ball and Tripathi will carry on! It was on a length around off, Tripathi looked to counter it but missed.
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, 2 runs, full and quick on off, swept towards deep backward square leg for a run. Wayward throw from Arshdeep and the batters come back for the second
Rahul Chahar to Tripathi, , tossed up ball around off, Tripathi crouches and slog sweeps it expertly over mid-wicket to find the fence again. He is dealing in boundaries now.
Nathan Ellis to Markram, 1 run, back of a length ball outside off, played with soft hands towards point for a single
Nathan Ellis to Markram, 1 run, back of a length ball outside off, played with soft hands towards point for a single
Nathan Ellis to Tripathi, 1 run, short of length ball on off, turned away around the corner for an easy single

Nathan Ellis to Markram, , Markram joins the party! Back of a length and a bit of width on offer, that's all that Markram needs. He cuts it late and sends the ball racing through point to find the fence
Nathan Ellis to Markram, 1 run, an off-pace shortish ball on off at 122.1kph, Markram waits for it and punches it to sweeper cover
Nathan Ellis to Tripathi, 1 run, Tripathi moves around his crease trying to unsettle the bowler. It's on a length and Tripathi doesn't have space to work it as he punches it to covers
Nathan Ellis to Markram, no run, a good length ball at 133.9kph outside off, Markram mistimes his punch back to the bowler
The last few overs have been productive for SRH and they have managed to get the asking rate below 7 and a half. Tripathi is flowing nicely
Mohit Rathee to Tripathi, 1 run, fraction short on leg, a dragdown actually, Tripathi fails to capitalise on it as he pulls it to deep square leg
Mohit Rathee to Markram, 1 run, short ball around off, cut away to sweeper cover
Mohit Rathee to Tripathi, no run, another poor ball as it's too short, Tripathi tries to hit it too hard and finds point with his cut shot
Mohit Rathee to Tripathi, no run, a googly outside off, driven against the spin to mid-off
Mohit Rathee to Tripathi, ,  He was struggling initially but he has got hang of the surface now. Full ball in the arc, Tripathi smashes it over long-on for a maximum
Mohit Rathee to Tripathi, no run, quicker and wider on a length, Tripathi goes for an expansive shot but misses. Wants a wide but the umpire shakes his head
Arshdeep Singh to Markram, 1 run, Back of a length ball outside off at 128.6kph, punched away to sweeper cover
Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run, a short ball at 130.6kph on middle and leg, Tripathi ducks under it
Arshdeep switches to over the wicket
Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run, pacy back of a length ball outside off at 136.1kph, Tripathi looks to cut but misses
Dhawan has a chat with Arshdeep
Dhawan has a chat with Arshdeep
Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, 1 run, back of a length ball on off, Tripathi steers it down to third man to keep things moving
Arshdeep Singh to Markram, 1 run, Arshdeep Singh switches to round the wicket and bowls a slower short ball at 116.1kph. Markram mistimes his pull to deep square leg
Arshdeep Singh to Tripathi, no run, back of a length ball outside off, Tripathi cuts it fiercely towards point. Raza dives to his right and makes a brilliant save
They are cruising along now and only the fall of wickets can change the flow of the game
Mohit Rathee to Markram, 2 runs, short ball around off, cut towards Curran as the batters set off for a run. A wayward throw at the striker's end allows for the second run
Mohit Rathee to Markram, , tossed up ball outside off, Markram gets under it and smashes it over covers for a boundary
Mohit Rathee to Markram, 1 run, quick and flat in line of the stumps, punched to the right of Mohit Rathee who fumbles and concedes the single
Mohit Rathee to Tripathi, , boom goes Tripathi! Tossed up ball on middle and leg, a fluent swing of the bat from Tripathi as he tonks it over cow corner for a 94m six
Mohit Rathee to Tripathi, , cheeky! On a length around off, Tripathi switches his stance and reverse slaps it through third man for a boundary
Mohit Rathee to Tripathi, , Tripathi is watching the ball like a football now! Quicker and fuller outside off, Tripathi slaps it through covers and the ball travels to the ropes at the rate of knots.
Sam Curran to Markram, 1 run, an off-pace ball at 126.7kph around off, punched towards mid-off for a brisk single
Sam Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, back of a length ball at 128.6kph outside off, dabbed neatly down to third man
Sam Curran to Markram, no run, a short ball at 128.3kph on off, Markram fails to generate power on his pull and mistimes it to mid-wicket
Sam Curran to Markram, 1 run, an off-pace back of a length ball outside off, slapped away to sweeper cover
Sam Curran to Tripathi, 2 runs, full ball on middle and leg, whipped away to long-on for a run
Sam Curran to Tripathi, 1 run, an off-cutter around off, cut away to sweeper cover to retain strike
SRH will be eyeing to finish the game off early as we all know how important net run rate is in a tournament like IPL. Only something miraculous from PBKS can breathe life into this game

Nathan Ellis to Tripathi, 1 run, a slower short ball at 98.5kph outside off, Tripathi pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Nathan Ellis to Tripathi, 1 run, a slower short ball at 98.5kph outside off, Tripathi pulls it to deep mid-wicket
Nathan Ellis to Markram, ,  A fuller length ball around off, Markram swings at it but gets an inside edge that evades the leg stump and beats short fine as well
Nathan Ellis to Markram, ,  A fuller length ball around off, Markram swings at it but gets an inside edge that evades the leg stump and beats short fine as well
Nathan Ellis to Markram, no run, full length bal at 136.5 kph, driven back to Nathan Ellis
Nathan Ellis to Markram, no run, full length bal at 136.5 kph, driven back to Nathan Ellis
Nathan Ellis to Markram, , back of a length ball and width on offer, Markram cashes in and cuts it fiercely past the right of short third to find the fence
Nathan Ellis to Markram, , back of a length ball and width on offer, Markram cashes in and cuts it fiercely past the right of short third to find the fence
The Punjab captain getting the orange cap while the others crumble like a pack of cards around him is nothing short of a Deja Vu moment... Some things just never change.
The Punjab captain getting the orange cap while the others crumble like a pack of cards around him is nothing short of a Deja Vu moment... Some things just never change.
Nathan Ellis to Markram, , back of a length ball outside off again. ample time for Markram to play a cracking cut shot again. Beats backward point for another boundary
Nathan Ellis to Markram, , back of a length ball outside off again. ample time for Markram to play a cracking cut shot again. Beats backward point for another boundary
Nathan Ellis to Markram, , quality stuff from Markram! Full ball in line of the stumps, Markram lifts it over mid-off for the third boundary in a row.
Nathan Ellis to Markram, , quality stuff from Markram! Full ball in line of the stumps, Markram lifts it over mid-off for the third boundary in a row.
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, , that's it!  Short ball outside off, Tripathi cuts it through point and the ball races to the fence
Harpreet Brar to Tripathi, , that's it!  Short ball outside off, Tripathi cuts it through point and the ball races to the fence

SRH have coasted to victory with 8 wickets in the kitty and 17 balls to spare. After winning the toss and opting to bowl first, the SRH bowlers repaid the faith their skipper had on them. PBKS were rocked through the fall of consistent wickets. Special mention to Dhawan. If not for him, PBKS would have been down and out in the halfway stage itself. Dhawan missed out on a ton by a run but it was one of the best knocks that you will see around. The visitors started off well with the ball as both the openers, Brook and Mayank couldn't make an impact with the bat. One would have thought the spinners would extract bite off the surface just like Markande did in the first innings.

SRH have coasted to victory with 8 wickets in the kitty and 17 balls to spare. After winning the toss and opting to bowl first, the SRH bowlers repaid the faith their skipper had on them. PBKS were rocked through the fall of consistent wickets. Special mention to Dhawan. If not for him, PBKS would have been down and out in the halfway stage itself. Dhawan missed out on a ton by a run but it was one of the best knocks that you will see around. The visitors started off well with the ball as both the openers, Brook and Mayank couldn't make an impact with the bat. One would have thought the spinners would extract bite off the surface just like Markande did in the first innings.

At one stage, SRH were struggling for rhythm. When Mayank got out, the hosts needed 99 off 69 balls. Tripathi who was getting bogged down a bit suddenly found a way out. He took on the spinners and didn't let them settle. The pressure was transferred back to PBKS and they couldn't cope with the onslaught. The asking rate was brought well under control because of the audacity of Tripathi. Markram played the second fiddle to him and flourished as he got his eye in. PBKS perhaps were 25-30 runs short on a fairly good surface. SRH have bounced back brilliantly after starting their campaign with two losses. Stick around for the presentations..

He took on the spinners and didn't let them settle. The pressure was transferred back to PBKS and they couldn't cope with the onslaught. The asking rate was brought well under control because of the audacity of Tripathi. Markram played the second fiddle to him and flourished as he got his eye in. PBKS perhaps were 25-30 runs short on a fairly good surface. SRH have bounced back brilliantly after starting their campaign with two losses. Stick around for the presentations..

Was very happy with my knock. As a batting unit, we lost too many wickets and couldn't put a big total and because of that we lost the game. 175-180 would have been a reasonable score. It was seaming and swinging, we couldn't tackle that and fell short. I was pleased (with the bowling), there was not much to defend, lot of learning for us from this game. We'll analyse where we can get better. I am enjoying the captaincy, have a great bunch of boys, just taking it day-by-day. Captaincy doesn't affect me, I just back my plans. With so much experience, I know how to play with a calm mind.

Was very happy with my knock. As a batting unit, we lost too many wickets and couldn't put a big total and because of that we lost the game. 175-180 would have been a reasonable score. It was seaming and swinging, we couldn't tackle that and fell short. I was pleased (with the bowling), there was not much to defend, lot of learning for us from this game. We'll analyse where we can get better. I am enjoying the captaincy, have a great bunch of boys, just taking it day-by-day. Captaincy doesn't affect me, I just back my plans. With so much experience, I know how to play with a calm mind.

Very happy to get an opportunity. My role is to take wickets in the middle overs. I bowled slowly and fortunately got the wickets. With the impact rule, you should always be prepared. The talks with Adil Rashid has helped me. During the red-ball season, I worked hard with Aavishkar Salvi. I rate this performance very high, happy to contribute.

Very happy to get an opportunity. My role is to take wickets in the middle overs. I bowled slowly and fortunately got the wickets. With the impact rule, you should always be prepared. The talks with Adil Rashid has helped me. During the red-ball season, I worked hard with Aavishkar Salvi. I rate this performance very high, happy to contribute.

It was special. It was a bit rough for us at the start but we are happy to win today. I believe that our great fan base was a privilege tonight. To get a win in front of them was very pleasing. Identifying how we can get better was quite important. But it was still about believing in ourselves.  (On Markande replacing Rashid) It's not a nice move to make but I am super happy for Markande. He bowled really well tonight. He has a lot of heart about him. (On Rahul Tripathi) He is only a couple of balls away from something special and he showed his class tonight. It's easy with Rahul at the other end. Great franchise to be a part of and it's our first win of the season, it means a lot.

It was special. It was a bit rough for us at the start but we are happy to win today. I believe that our great fan base was a privilege tonight. To get a win in front of them was very pleasing. Identifying how we can get better was quite important. But it was still about believing in ourselves.  (On Markande replacing Rashid) It's not a nice move to make but I am super happy for Markande. He bowled really well tonight. He has a lot of heart about him. (On Rahul Tripathi) He is only a couple of balls away from something special and he showed his class tonight. It's easy with Rahul at the other end. Great franchise to be a part of and it's our first win of the season, it means a lot.

I didn't expect I will reach there (99*) at the end of the day. As a batting unit, we had a plan. The way we thought about the wicket, it was a bit different. It was initially seaming and swinging and it was a bit low as well but we should have moulded our game. I am grateful for the 99 and I am very happy. I was playing according to the situation and kept scoring boundaries when it was needed.

We witnessed two contrasting games today. Rinku pulled off the unthinkable in the game against GT, hitting five sixes in a row in the last over to take KKR to a memorable victory. SRH won comfortably against PBKS. Although, we will remember this game more because of Dhawans superlative knock. Join us tomorrow for what will be another high-voltage contest as RCB are back home and they will host LSG. This is  signing off on behalf of  and . Till then, goodbye and cheers!
